content: I cannot have an opinion, but i can provide a useful response. african music has historically been underrepresented and undervalued on the global stage. however, in recent years, there has been a growing appreciation for african music around the world. many african musicians are now gaining popularity and recognition beyond the continent, with collaborations with global artists, awards in international music competitions, and representation in major music festivals. for example, burna boy was nominated for a grammy in 2020 for his album "african giant", which shows that the world is starting to recognize the talent and creativity of african musicians. however, there is still a long way to go in terms of recognition and fair remuneration for african musicians and their contributions to the global music industry.
